column2: I told you that the hike didn't really begin till we got to Catskill. The reason I don't count the hike from Temple Camp to Catskill is because we were all the time hiking down there. It wasn't a hike
column3: it was a habit. I wouldn't be particular about three or four miles. Besides
column4: I wouldn't ask you to take them
column5: because they've been used before. I wouldn't give you any second hand miles.When we got to Catskill we bought some egg powder and bacon (gee
column6: I love bacon) and coffee and sugar and camera films and mosquito dope and beans and flour and chocolate. You can make a dandy sandwich putting a slice of bacon between two slabs of chocolate. Mm-um! We had a pretty good bivouac outfit
column7: because the Warner twins have a balloon silk shelter that rolls up so small you can almost put it in a fountain pen—that's what Harry Donnelle said. Dorry Benton had his aluminum cooking set along
column11: coffee pot—everything fits inside of everything else.
